content: Then the word of the  came to me, saying:
“Son of man, how is the wood of the vine  than any other wood, the vine branch which is among the trees of the forest?
Is wood taken from it to make any object? Or can  make a peg from it to hang any vessel on?
Instead, it is thrown into the fire for fuel; the fire devours both ends of it, and its middle is burned. Is it useful for  work?
Indeed, when it was whole, no object could be made from it. How much less will it be useful for  work when the fire has devoured it, and it is burned?
“Therefore thus says the Lord : ‘Like the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so I will give up the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
and I will set My face against them. They will go out from  fire, but  fire shall devour them. Then you shall know that I  the , when I set My face against them.
Thus I will make the land desolate, because they have persisted in unfaithfulness,’ says the Lord .”Cross references
